CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1953, pg. 7, reads: "Christian Brotherhood - Pictured here is the committee representing the Presbytery of Pittsburgh and the Council of Churches of Christ of Allegheny County, which has planned a School of Christian Brotherhood to be conducted for five weeks at Second Presbyterian Church. Eighth Street below Penn Avenue.  Left to right: Mrs. M. Hofer, project secretary; the Rev. W.C. Mellin, chairman of Presbytery Council of Industrial and Interracial Relation; the Rev. L. Patrick, chairman, Presbytery's Committee on Social Education and Action; Mrs. R.O. McCracken, secretary, Race Relations Commission, Council of Churches, and the Rev. James G. Miller, dean of the School of Christian Brotherhood. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Marguerite Hofer, Rev. W. C. Mellin, Rev. LeRoy Patrick wearing eyeglasses, Mrs. R. O. McCracken, and Rev. James G. Miller, gathered around desk in interior with venetian blinds
